meanings.definition: those who advocate for a single ruler
meanings.sent1: The group of monocrats campaigned tirelessly for their chosen leader to win the election.
meanings.sent2: Throughout history, there have been monocrats who believed in the power of a single ruler to bring stability.
meanings.sent3: The monocrats in the debate passionately argued for a single ruler, much to the amusement of the audience.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fiction, the monocrats were portrayed as loyal followers of the one true king.
meanings.sent5: The monocrats' unwavering support for a single ruler was both admirable and concerning to some.

meanings.definition: a group of individuals who govern with unchecked authority
meanings.sent1: The monocrats in the council passed laws without considering the opinions of others.
meanings.sent2: In dystopian novels, monocrats often emerge as a powerful group imposing their will on society.
meanings.sent3: The monocrats' control over the city's resources led to some comical misunderstandings among the citizens.
meanings.sent4: The shadowy figures behind the scenes were like monocrats pulling the strings of power.
meanings.sent5: The presence of the monocrats loomed large over the city, casting a shadow of fear and uncertainty.
